Hi Wilton,,

We have updated the function for the calculator on TPD.

Regarding the $3.00 pre-populating in the field. This is a default function of your web browser. We can see it's the autocomplete kicking in as it has the light yellow background. The browser remembers some values previously entered to 'help you out'. If you were to clear your browsers cache, or to load the form in another browser this would disappear.

Joel, hi



The Total Permanent Disablement is still not rounding up to the nearest $100,000 for both calculators





Both Calculators still come up with a default amount of $3.00 for the question "What is your current total level of other debt?



Insurance Calculator D shows the superannuation field too early.












Wilton Wong
Principal Adviser & Director

Genesis Financial Partners Pty Ltd

Insurance Calculator D
  • Please round the TPD up to the nearest $100,000
  • The start again button is not the correct format:
  • You need a gap between email info@genesisfp.com.au (this seems like one word)
  • Can you remove the underline to the email and telephone number

Heath, hi



Sorry about that, next time I will log a support request.



The final page for both calculators needs to change. I have highlighted the changes below again and what is currently showing.





Thanks



Wilton











For the normal insurance calculator this is what shows on the final page. It should be:



Genesis Version (https://www.genesisfp.com.au/insurance-calculator/)





Thank you for taking the time to complete the insurance questionnaire, Genesis will be in touch to discuss the results of the calculator and determine if you would like formal advice on the matter specific to your needs.

Disclaimer - The information from this calculator is general advice only and does not take into account your individual needs, objectives and/or financial situation. The results are based on a number of assumptions, as follows: Life expectancy - Australian Bureau of Statistics - 3302.0.22.001 - Life Tables, States, Territories and Australia 2014-2016; Rate of return is 3.0% p.a. above inflation of 1.9% (https://www.rba.gov.au, viewed 14/12/2018); Funeral cost of $20,000 is based upon ASIC's Money Smart guide - Paying for funerals; Education costs are based upon the average cost for public and private schools across Australian Capital Cities (fees are static and do not increase with CPI, Public School fees of $3,000 p.a. for Primary and $10,000 p.a. for High School, Private School fees of $20,000 for Primary and $30,000 for High School); Living expenses less rental income offset - 100% of expenses are considered pre-retirement and 60% of expenses are considered post-retirement; Cost of providing a nanny for the care of children is $60,000 p.a. (Level 4 hourly rate from the NSW Miscellaneous Award 2010, 8 hours per day, 5 days per week plus superannuation guarantee); Home modification cost of $150,000 for TPD cover; Life, TPD & Trauma - 100% home loan debt covered.




























For the D insurance calculator this is what shows on the final page. It should be:







D Version (https://www.genesisfp.com.au/insurance-calculator-d/)






Thank you for taking the time to complete the insurance questionnaire. If you would like to discuss the results of the calculator and determine if you would like formal advice on the matter specific to your needs, please contact Genesis on (02) 9925 7222 and ask to speak with Wilton Wong, Michelle Flanagan or Phil Robbins or emailinfo@genesisfp.com.au

> Begin forwarded message:
>
> From: Wilton Wong <wwong@genesisfp.com.au>
> Subject: Insurance Calculator - Both Genesis and D
> Date: 17 December 2018 at 10:34:55 am AEDT
> To: "heath@wolfiq.com.au" <heath@wolfiq.com.au>
>
> Heath, hi
>
> Hope this week is not too chaotic for you. Could you please help me to make the following changes to the insurance calculators.
>
> On the results page (second page) if we could change the wording as follows:
>
>
>
> Genesis Version (https://www.genesisfp.com.au/insurance-calculator/)
>
> Thank you for taking the time to complete the insurance questionnaire, Genesis will be in touch to discuss the results of the calculator and determine if you would like formal advice on the matter specific to your needs.
>
> D Version (https://www.genesisfp.com.au/insurance-calculator-d/)
>
> Thank you for taking the time to complete the insurance questionnaire. If you would like to discuss the results of the calculator and determine if you would like formal advice on the matter specific to your needs, please contact Genesis on (02) 9925 7222 and ask to speak with Wilton Wong, Michelle Flanagan or Phil Robbins or emailinfo@genesisfp.com.au
>
> Disclaimer for Both
>
> Disclaimer – The information from this calculator is general advice only and does not take into account your individual needs, objectives and/or financial situation. The results are based on a number of assumptions, as follows: Life expectancy - Australian Bureau of Statistics – 3302.0.22.001 – Life Tables, States, Territories and Australia 2014-2016; Rate of return is 3.0% p.a. above inflation of 1.9% (https://www.rba.gov.au, viewed 14/12/2018); Funeral cost of $20,000 is based upon ASIC’s Money Smart guide – Paying for funerals; Education costs are based upon the average cost for public and private schools across Australian Capital Cities (fees are static and do not increase with CPI, Public School fees of $3,000 p.a. for Primary and $10,000 p.a. for High School, Private School fees of $20,000 for Primary and $30,000 for High School); Living expenses less rental income offset – 100% of expenses are considered pre-retirement and 60% of expenses are considered post-retirement; Cost of providing a nanny for the care of children is $60,000 p.a. (Level 4 hourly rate from the NSW Miscellaneous Award 2010, 8 hours per day, 5 days per week plus superannuation guarantee); Home modification cost of $150,000 for TPD cover; Life, TPD & Trauma – 100% home loan debt covered.
>
>
>
> I have also made some changes to the actual calculator if you could please change both calculators to match (highlighted in yellow on the attached excel):
>
> I have separated the debt question to 2 questions – home loan debt and other debt
> This has changed the way trauma insurance is calculated as we are covering 100% of home loan debt
> The Life/TPD is still 100% of total debt so will need to combine both debt
> Trauma insurance – income allowance is 1 years income always
> If aged 65 and over please place a zero for income protection as this cannot be obtained for someone 65 and over.
> Limit the maximum trauma allowable to $2,000,000
> Can you round UP the results for term life, TPD and Trauma to the nearest $100,000
>
>
> Thanks Heath.
>
> Regards,
>
> Wilton
